before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fkgtd","text":"Timing suggestions (allow more time until well familiar): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e679g","text":"The calculations can be prepared the day before (Day1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtfbs","text":"Sample preparation, MspI digestion, Adaptor ligation - 6 hours with 48 samples; full day with 96 samples (Day 2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ue97","text":"End repair, Purification and Bisulfite conversion - 6 hours (48 samples); full day (96 samples); BS reaction left O/N (Day 3)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u773","text":"Bisulfite-converted DNA desulfonation and purification, library amplification (left O/N) - 6 hours (48 samples); full day (96 samples) (add extra time for optional qPCR) (Day 4)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i5cd","text":"Amplified library purification and quality control – half a day (48-96 samples); (Day 5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cfner","text":"This protocol describes a library prep procedure for 1 to 96 samples with the Ovation RRBS Methyl-seq System. The original Tecan Ovation protocol describes a low throughput procedure, therefore this protocol is especially targeted for manual high-throughput preps from 24 to 96 samples, although it can be used for small sample numbers too. Importantly, the Ovation RRBS kit is currently sold as oxBS only (identifying both 5-methyl-C and 5-hydroxymethyl-C), whilst this protocol is modified to exclude the oxidation step and describes a basic RRBS, where both 5mC and 5hmC appear as the same positive signal and are indistinguishable. This protocol has a few further modifications, specifically in the bisulfite conversion step and bead purifications, which have performed better in our hands. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"13lvn","text":"Ovation RRBS Methyl-seq library prep (up to 96 samples) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vo6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bsqa","text":"This protocol is based on Tecan’s Ovation oxBS RRBS protocol, but without the oxidation step, making it suitable for analysing methylation and not hydroxy-methylation. Tecan do not provide a protocol for their 96-sample kit, they have a protocol for 1-16 samples. This protocol is therefore adjusted for a higher-throughput for 24 up to 96 sample preparation.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22c0k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b19d","text":"Tecan recommend processing not more than 3 strips (24 samples) at a time manually, which means splitting a 96-sample kit in 4 batches. This consideration is mainly because of the washing steps, where timing is crucial and there is a risk of over-drying the beads and reducing yield. This protocol describes a procedure for the washes, which works for manual handling, but does require good pipetting and laboratory experience. The protocol is not designed by Tecan for automated steps (with liquid handling systems), although automation is possible in principle, however, some volumes are too low for most robots. In our personal experience from performing automated wash steps, however, yields can be lower due to loss of beads - a careful manual prep can deliver a 10 to 100-fold higher library yields and much higher quantity consistency between the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"advdc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rmgq","text":"Unmethylated DNA control must be purchased separately – this is optional but advisable to include.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

The starting unmethylated DNA stock will be highly concentrated and a dilution will be required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":192,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvu6h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5k58s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.1","error":false,"guid":"E909E4A008D511EEAEAC5D47494C95CA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9nikn","text":"The easiest and least error-prone approach to do this step, is to calculate in MS Excel the exact amounts of DNA, unmethylated control and water, ordered by ascending DNA quantities. {"blocks":[{"key":"8kmo5","text":"Prepare the unmethylated DNA control – add the necessary total volume to the total volume of water (from the calculations, sum up the unmethylated control DNA and water volumes for all samples), and pre-mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a8c3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jk4r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fe2m4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ct8ir","text":"The amounts of unmethylated control to be added per sample are so low that it is practically best to pre-mix with the water, even if that means slightly different final ratios per sample.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"85dgi","text":"Air dry the beads on the magnet for 5-10 minutes. Inspect each tube carefully to ensure that all of the ethanol has evaporated. It is critical that all residual ethanol be removed prior to continuing, but it is also critical to not let beads over-dry as this reduces yield (they have over-dried when they crack).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5st4u","text":"Remove the tubes from the magnet and add   DR1 Resuspension buffer to the dried beads (with dispenser aiming at the beads). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"50078290075811EEB692ABABD2CA38D7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nqqq","text":"Mix thoroughly with a multichannel pipette, set at  , to ensure all beads are resuspended – if the beads have cracked this may require mixing for a few minutes. Take any beads remaining on the sides and make sure all beads are covered in solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"53EA13F0075811EEB692ABABD2CA38D7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"701de","text":"Seal the plate/close the tubes and centrifuge briefly to collect sample at bottom of the tubes/wells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80g7e","text":"Carefully remove the seal one column/strip at a time, and aspirate   of the eluate, ensuring as few beads as possible are carried over, and transfer to a fresh plate / set of PCR tubes. Keep the eluate on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1iso3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4d96b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"19","error":false,"guid":"78FD0B70075811EEB692ABABD2CA38D7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"10g1p","text":"Pipetting options: Aspirate directly 19 μL (riskier), or aspirate 9.5 μL twice, with thin 10 μL low retention tips - the latter can make easier handling of the last few microliters nearer the beads during the second aspiration.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1er3q","text":"Eluting can be slow and may require repetitions if beads are sucked in the tip. The seal ensures there is no evaporation in the remaining wells and facilitates the transfer of equal amounts of eluate/yield. Sealing or covering the plate/strips with the ready eluate is also advisable to avoid mistakes. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ssk2","text":"Once the elution is complete, proceed with preparing library aliquots for a Tapestation QC run in the next section Library Quality Control (QC). If QC is not planned soon, seal the library plate well and store at   . {"blocks":[{"key":"1798b","text":"Aliquot   of nuclease-free water in the wells of a 96-well plate, matching the number and positions of eluted libraries (this is for a 1 in 2 dilution, respectively, higher dilutions can also be used, depending on QC equipment sensitivity). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cc1at","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brusc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bc3ov","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hnki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"4670B7A0075911EEB692ABABD2CA38D7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"75uvi","text":"Be quick with this step because of evaporation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"6e09j","text":"Wear gloves and a laboratory coat at all times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a71e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hts3","text":"This high-throughput manual protocol is demanding on the hands and thumbs for tip ejection. Make sure to choose multichannel pipettes, which do not require extreme force for tip ejection by the thumb (ideally tip ejection should NOT be performed with the thumb - see CAPP multichannel pipettes design). Excessive thumb workload by multichannel pipetting is a major cause of repetitive strain injuries.
